title: Apple Foundation Course â€“ Design & Coding Experience
excerpt: The Apple Foundation Course was a three-week program where my team designed and built an iOS app using SwiftUI in Xcode, collaborating through research, design, and development. 🚀
content:
The Apple Foundation Course was an intensive three-week program focused on design and coding, where my team and I collaborated to develop a fully functional iOS application using SwiftUI in Xcode.

Team & Roles
I worked in a team of four, with a dynamic and flexible structure:

2/3 researchers who gathered insights, defined user needs, and shaped the problem space.
1 programmer (me) responsible for implementing the app in SwiftUI/Xcode and ensuring its functionality.
4 designers, including myself, focused on UI/UX design, prototyping, and refining the appâ€™s look and feel.
Course Phases
Week 1: Design & Research

Used Miro for brainstorming, wireframing, and planning the user experience.
Conducted research and ideation to define the appâ€™s core functionality.
Developed high-fidelity UI/UX prototypes.
Week 2: Coding & Development

Transitioned from design to development, implementing the app using SwiftUI in Xcode.
Focused on UI implementation, app logic, and debugging.
Iterated based on feedback to refine the user experience.
Week 3: Finalization & Presentation

Polished the app by optimizing UI, fixing bugs, and preparing for launch.
Prepared a presentation showcasing our design process, technical implementation, and final product.
Graduated from the program with a final pitch and demonstration of our application.
Key Takeaways
Gained hands-on experience in collaborative app development, from ideation to final implementation.
Strengthened skills in SwiftUI, Xcode, and UI/UX design principles.
Learned the importance of team dynamics and cross-functional collaboration in app development.
author: Zinny
